duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the day-to-day operation of the Program in Baltimore City and Baltimore County, ensuring the highest quantity and quality standards are met.
Provide direct supervision to Case Managers, guiding the development of Individual Service Plans (ISP) for each participant.
Track family progress and ensure adherence to ISP and Participant Agreement.
Collaborate with employment service providers, integrate workforce development into case management, and provide access to navigation services.
Ensure staff adherence to the principles of Trauma-Informed Care and Crisis Prevention and Mediation.
Develop and provide ongoing training for program staff, conduct regular supervision, and develop programs for staff incentives and retention.
Create an outreach plan, coordinate outreach activities, and maintain documentation of program statistics.
Maintain an active database for referrals and community partners, coordinate on-site services, and create a welcoming environment for volunteers.
Attend necessary meetings, events, and uphold the vision, mission, and values of the organization.
Perform other duties as assigned within the scope of the position.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Social Work or related field, required.
